Title.I: could have, should have, would have

GapFillDropdown.Instruction: Read the newspaper article, then click on the correct answers in the sentences below.

P.FONT: A twelve-year-old schoolgirl has been arrested because she threw a snowball at a police officer’s car.

Natalie Green was having a snowball fight with a friend when she threw one and it hit the back window of a police car and broke it. The police officer arrested the girl and took her to the local police station. Her mother was phoned but she was working and it took her one hour to get to the police station.

The police took Natalie’s fingerprints and kept her alone in a small room before her mother arrived. She then had to sign a ‘caution.’ This means that her name will stay on the police computer for the next five years.
‘Natalie is a good girl and I’m sure she didn’t intend to break the car window,’ said her mother. ‘This is absolutely ridiculous!’
But police officer Stuart Park said, ‘She might be a nice girl from an ordinary family, but she broke the law. She was lucky that there was no-one sitting in the back seat of the car.’
